intro: Racosperma quadrisulcatum, commonly known as the four-ribbed acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often multi-branched stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense, cylindrical clusters. Its leaves are bipinnate, with numerous small leaflets that give it a feathery appearance. Racosperma quadrisulcatum is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
